detailsOfAchievement: We are working on a Project styled SWAPNANEER to provide life long care and shelter for Persons with Intellectual Developmental Disabilities (PwIDD). The Project building has been constructed up to 2 nd floor with the 1st floor complete with 11 dwelling units , 2 dormitories. All common facilities have been created at Ground floor. We also take part in various workshops, programmes related to rehabilitation of PwIDDs, creating awareness of parents organised by government and non-government institutions.

title: Purba Paschim
detailsOfAchievement: About Purba Paschim Purba Paschim was launched in the year 2005, with Bratya Basus play Babli. Since then Purba Paschim has been our pride, and who knows, might be the neighbors envy also. In the debut year, Babli had the unique distinction of touring France, UK and USA, and receiving appreciation and accolade all around. We vowed to keep up the good work. Next year, after a conspicuous absence for about two decades, Brecht returned to the city of kolkata with a bang, and Purba Paschim was the proud facilitator. Based on his famous play Good Person of Setzuan, the Bengali adaptation Angshumati stormed the city and the state as well, under the direction of Ramaprasad Banik, a leading playwright-director-actor of this time. Full house in kolkata, and demand from various parts of the state speak volumes about its success. Now comes an Indian play by none other than Grish Karnad, considered one of the very best of our modern playwrights. According to the director of play ,Bhibhas Chakraborty , Mr Karnads The Fire and the Rain (original Kannad title, Agni Mattu Male), based on an episode of Mahabharata, set in the background of our Vedic and Desi traditions, is nothing short of classic, which inspired him to prepare a Bengali playscript under the title Agnijal. And this is also precisely the reason why Mr. Chakraborty , while directing the play for Purba Paschim, chose to work with a team of countrys best designers like Bhaskar Chandravarkar, Kriti B Sharma, Dilip Tamuley. After Agnijal, Purba Paschim staged another important theatre based on Rabindra Nath Tagores novel Chaturanga. The versatile features of these novel and a journey gave theatre lovers a different essence of beauty. Chaturanga hits the heart of theatre passion with its music, stage craft, lighting and moreover acting. This is now talk of the town running in full house. Very Recently Purba Paschim has produced Diba Ratrir Kabya  from a Novel Of Manik Bandopadhayay and Directed by Arun Mukhopadhayay. This has been successfully launched in the Odeon Festival. In the year 2009, Purba Paschim launched its new Theatre Patol Babu Filmstar based on Satyajit Rays story & directed by Ramaprasad Banik. The inaugural ceremony was attended by Shabana Azmi , Sandip Ray & many noted personalities. This production is now a talk of the town. Apart from theatre production, Purba Paschim organizes workshops, academic session, seminars regularly and published a yearly magazine on Theatre. In the year 2009 , Purba Paschim paid attribute to Habib Tanvir organizing an exhibition on the legendary theatre personality. The exhibition was inaugurated by Girish Karnad & attended by Mr Gopal Krishna Gandhi, Governor of West Bengal, Ms Anuradha Kapoor, Director National School of Drama. This programme was followed by a Theatre Festival where all the productions of Purba Paschim were performed & Naya Theatre was invited to perform Charandas Chor.

detailsOfAchievement: You would be glad to know that over the last few years our college has witnessed major achievements in the field of academic and research activities. Not only has it been conferred the Autonomous Status, but it has also been given the much coveted status of Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (SIRO) by DST, Government of India. This has enabled the college to enjoy 175% tax exemption on all donations towards Research and Development of the College. The college is at present one of the leading colleges in the Eastern Region with a very high score of 3.56 CGPA out of 4.00, awarded by NAAC in 2012. Along with these new achievements, there has been manifold increase in the activities of the college. The three Postgraduate Departments - Chemistry, Physics and English - have initiated various research projects. Moreover, it has recently been conferred the status of CPE (Colleges with potential for excellence) by the UGC.

title: Ramakrishna Mission Vivekananda University
detailsOfAchievement: Ramakrishna Mission Vivekananda University is a multi-campus University, under the aegis of the Ramakrishna Mission. The University came into existence in July 2005. Declared as deemed-to-be-university by Ministry of Human Resource Development, Govt. of India, under Section 3 of UGC Act, 1956, the University has its head office at Belur and operates through its various off-campus Faculty centers located at different branch centers of Ramakrishna Mission. Thrust areas of the University: 1. Disability Management and Special Education 2. Integrated Rural Development including Tribal Development 3. Indian Cultural and Spiritual Heritage and Value Education 4. Disaster Management including Relief and Rehabilitation 5. Fundamental Sciences - Integrated teaching and research Other Activities: For Rural Development, the University has set up 14 Village Resource Centres (VRCs) under a project called Vivekdisha with the assistance of ISRO (Indian Space Research Organization) to impart tele-education, tele-medicine services, value education programmes in schools, and interaction with self-help groups etc in rural areas of West Bengal and Jharkhand.
